Reported to Senate from the Committee on Agriculture and Forestry with amendment, S. Rept. 94-894.
Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.

Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.

official_title: A bill to amend the Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act of 1974.
short_title: Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act Amendments

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Agriculture and Forestry with amendment, S. Rept. 94-1488) Repeals the requirement under the Commodity Exchange Act that the appointment of the exeuctive director of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission be subject to confirmation by the Senate. Requires the maintenance of daily trading records in a specified manner and form by floor brokers. Extends from 30 days to six months the time when the registration of any commodity trading advisor or commodity pool operator is to become effective after the Commission's receipt of the application. Extends the antifraud provisions of the Act to persons who should be registered under such Act. Authorizes the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to grant immunity to witnesses appearing before the Commission. Includes within the provisions of the Commodity Exchange Act prohibitions now contained in the Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act against beverage and margin contracts contrary to rules and regulations of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission.

titles.title: Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act Amendments
A bill to amend the Commodity Futures Trading Commission Act of 1974.
